lines.content: ### Feature: View your list of Tasks
Request Duke to show the list of tasks you have to complete
### Feature: Add, remove, or complete a task on/to your list
You can add or remove specific tasks to your list and also mark them as complete when you finish them off
### Feature: Save the list as a file/ import a file to your list
You get to save your list at the end of the session as a file in the folder, and you can also place a file in the same format as required and import a list
Duke will print out the list when asked to
A list that is ordered and shows completion and type of task
### `todo` - add a todo task to the list
Duke will add a todo task to the list
Example of usage: todo study for midterm
A successful addition to the list
Got it. I have added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in your list.
### `event` - add an event task to the list
Duke will add the event with given parameters to the list
Example of usage: event midterm /at 6:00 PM
The event is successfully added to the list
Got it. I have added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in your list.
### `deadline` - add a deadline task to the list
Duke will add the deadline with the given parameters to the list
Example of usage: deadline homework /by 2:30 PM
The deadline task is successfully added to the list
Got it. I have added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in your list.
### `mark` - mark a task as complete on the list
Duke will mark the task at the given number as complete
If the task is on the list and incomplete it will be marked as complete
I have marked this task as complete
### `unmark` - mark a task on the list as incomplete
Duke will mark a task as incomplete on the list
The if the task is on the list and complete it will be marked as incomplete
Task was already marked like that
### `find` - find a word amongst the list
Duke will find tasks with names that contain the term the user wants to find
The list of terms with a matching string or that there are no matching entries
Here are the matching tasks in your list
### `delete` - delete a task from the list
Duke will delete the task at the given position from the list
The task gets removed from the list
Got it. I have removed this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in your list.
### `bye` - say bye to Duke and exit the program
Duke end the program and save the list to a file

* Used to read in user input and parse through the instructions
* given in order to understand what sort of command to process
* and action needs to take place
* Constructor for Parser that reads in list of tasks and stores it for future use
* The main method used within parser, the parse method reads in the next user inputted line
* determines what the command is based on the initial word of the input and performs
* corresponding tasks based off of it. When needing to add a new task to the TaskList
* it calls taskReader to take care of those various inputs, but it deals with marking and
* umarking tasks, removing tasks, exiting the program, finding a word, and listing the task

* and uses the first word of the input to determine the type of task, and reads through
* the rest of the input in order to create the tasks requested adn add it to the task list
* @throws DukeException when the input is not formatted correctly

* The storage class contains methods that converts the TaskList the user
* is currently working on to a file format and also converts it back
* from the file format into a workable TaskList form
* Gets the task list as an input, checks to see if the file already exists,
* if one exists it deletes it and creates a new one anyways and then reads
* the information from the task list into the file with the information
* about each task being separated by commas
* Called when the program starts up in order to work with saved task lists
* this function simply reads from the users file if it is in a workable format
* and turns it into an arraylist of tasks or just returns an empty array list
* if the file does not exist or is empty
* @return an arraylist of tasks that the file had info about
* Parent class for all the different task types, sets up the methods to be
* overridden and the base constructor with name and doneness
* Sets up an open constructor for a task with no name and not being done

* Allows the name of a task to be modified based on an input
* returns the name of the task upon getting called
* Sets the doneness of a task
* @param done is used to set the doneness of the task

* @return a base string representation of a task

* Method that does nothing here but is a placeholder to be overridden
* in the child classes of Task
* The taskList class is a class that stores a list of tasks
* and contains methods that works with that list, being able to
* add, delete, and get information about the tasks in the list
* Constructor of a task list if it is ever called upon with no parameters
* Constructor of a task list from a preexisting set of tasks from a file,
* The add function adds a task to the end of the list
* @param task task to be added to list
System.out.println("Got it. I have added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have "+tasks.size()+" tasks in your list.");
* Gets the task at the number indicated by the user
* @param num index of the task on the list you want to see

* Returns the arraylist of tasks if user needs to work with an arraylist instead
* Deletes the task from the task list at the indicated number
* @param num index of task to delete
System.out.println("Got it. I have removed this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have "+tasks.size()+" tasks in your list.");
